page.title: 17POPULATION CHANGES
page.content: An irreversible change has come to this once agricultural area, except in Wisley, which apart from one or two farms is the Royal Horticultural Society's village. There are farms scattered throughout, but most of the district has undergone a transform- ation to commuter country. Families are smaller. People move on as work takes them elsewhere. There is little unemployment. Adolescents are usually at day schools or later at University. In Wisley the small population is based on the Royal Horticultural Society. On retirement people frequently move to a less expensive area.
